page.title: 04FARMING IN MADDERTY,1985
page.content: This is mainly arable farmland.Barley is the main crop,but winter wheat and oil-seed rape are also grown. If the barley is good quality it goes to the distilleries to be made into whisky. Poor quality barley goes to feed cattle. Most farms have beef cattle, we have no dairy herds. Fields of grass are grown so that cattle can be grazed or to make hay and silage. There are pedigree Shorthorn and Aberdeen-Angus cattle on two farms. Some farmers have pedigree sheep Suffolk or Border Leicester. One farm breeds Clydesdale horses. There are two pig farms and one chicken farm in this area. Potatoes are grown for seed-potatoes. The farms have good modern farm-buildings and modern machinery.
